first_reading.text:
[[Is 26,7]]The way of the just is smooth; the path of the just you make level.
[[Is 26,8]]Yes, for your way and your judgments, O LORD, we look to you; Your name and your title are the desire of our souls.
[[Is 26,9]]My soul yearns for you in the night, yes, my spirit within me keeps vigil for you; When your judgment dawns upon the earth, the world's inhabitants learn justice.
[[Is 26,12]]O LORD, you mete out peace to us, for it is you who have accomplished all we have done.
[[Is 26,16]]O LORD, oppressed by your punishment, we cried out in anguish under your chastising.
[[Is 26,17]]As a woman about to give birth writhes and cries out in her pains, so were we in your presence, O LORD.
[[Is 26,18]]We conceived and writhed in pain, giving birth to wind; Salvation we have not achieved for the earth, the inhabitants of the world cannot bring it forth.
[[Is 26,19]]But your dead shall live, their corpses shall rise; awake and sing, you who lie in the dust. For your dew is a dew of light, and the land of shades gives birth.
first_reading.title: Book of Isaiah

gospel.text:

[[Mt 11,29]]Take my yoke upon you and learn from me, for I am meek and humble of heart; and you will find rest for yourselves.
[[Mt 11,30]]For my yoke is easy, and my burden light."
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Matthew

psalm.text:
[[Ps 102,13]]You, O LORD, abide forever, 
and your name through all generations.
[[Ps 102,14a]]You will arise and have mercy on Zion,
[[Ps 102,14b]]for it is time to pity her.
[[Ps 102,15]]For her stones are dear to your servants, 
and her dust moves them to pity.

[[Ps 102,16]]The nations shall revere your name, O LORD, 
and all the kings of the earth your glory,
[[Ps 102,17]]when the LORD has rebuilt Zion 
and appeared in his glory;
[[Ps 102,18]]when he has regarded the prayer of the destitute, 
and not despised their prayer.

[[Ps 102,19]]Let this be written for the generation to come, 
and let his future creatures praise the LORD:
[[Ps 102,20]]"The LORD looked down from his holy height, 
from heaven he beheld the earth,
[[Ps 102,21]]to hear the groaning of the prisoners, 
to release those doomed to die."
psalm.title: Psalms
